energy_drains:
- Rigid schedules and deadlines
- Administrative tasks, paperwork, anything boring
- People who don't get me
- Fluorescent lighting and sterile environments
- Having to explain myself repeatedly
energy_restores:
- Deep conversations about ideas
- Making something with my hands
- Being in nature, especially near water
- Music - both listening and playing
- Starting something new and exciting
identity_statements: I am someone who sees connections others miss. I am someone with too many interests. I am someone who feels deeply. I am someone who starts more than I finish. I am someone who needs meaning in my work. I am someone who is probably too sensitive.
others_describe: They'd say I'm interesting to talk to, maybe a bit intense. They'd say I'm creative but unreliable. My close friends would say I'm deeply loyal. Some would say I'm chaotic or flaky. Someone once said I have 'too many tabs open in my brain.'
automatic_behaviors:
- Stay up way too late on random rabbit holes
- Start new projects when current ones get hard
- Forget to eat when I'm in flow
- Overshare with strangers
- Rearrange my space when I'm stuck
- Buy supplies for hobbies I'll abandon
keystone_behaviors:
- Morning pages / journaling (when I actually do it)
- Making music, even for 10 minutes
- Connecting with one person I care about
natural_strengths:
- Generating ideas quickly
- Making people feel understood
- Seeing patterns and possibilities
- Adapting to new situations
- Finding beauty in unexpected places
resistance_patterns:
- Following through on long-term projects
- Keeping a consistent schedule
- Staying in one career/path
- Not taking criticism personally
- Finishing what I start
